intro: Ailanthus altissima var. leucoxyla, commonly known as the white-framed tree of China, is a variant of the tree of heaven, native to China. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its compound leaves with 12–20 pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in racemes, followed by distinctive seed pods containing silky-haired seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas due to its adaptability and rapid growth. Its botanical features make it both an ornamental plant and an invasive species in many regions.
